summary: Email chain between federal prosecutors and defense attorneys regarding compliance of Jeffrey Epstein's state plea agreement with a 2007 federal non-prosecution agreement. The prosecutors request a minor wording change to the plea agreement and confirm that the state plea is in compliance with the federal agreement.

persons.name: Jack Goldberger
persons.context: Defense attorney for Jeffrey Epstein corresponding with federal prosecutors to confirm the state plea agreement complies with the federal non-prosecution agreement.

persons.name: Roy Black
persons.context: Defense attorney for Jeffrey Epstein, copied on the initial notification of non-compliance from federal prosecutors.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The defendant whose state plea agreement is being reviewed for compliance with a prior federal non-prosecution agreement.

connections.description: Goldberger is acting as defense attorney for Epstein, negotiating and confirming compliance of the plea agreement.
Black is a defense attorney for Epstein, copied on legal correspondence regarding the plea agreement.
Both are defense attorneys representing Jeffrey Epstein, copied on the same legal correspondence.

events.title: Federal Non-Prosecution Agreement
events.description: A non-prosecution agreement entered into between Jeffrey Epstein and the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida.

events.title: Telephone Conference on Plea Compliance
events.description: Telephone conference at 6:30 pm between Jack Goldberger and a federal prosecutor discussing that Epstein's state plea agreement was in compliance with the federal non-prosecution agreement.

events.title: Prosecutor's Request for Plea Wording Change
events.description: Federal prosecutors request the insertion of the word 'imprisoned' following 'six months' in the sentencing paragraph of Epstein's state plea agreement.

locations: 500 S. Australian Ave, Suite 400, West Palm Beach, FL 33401
keyFacts: Federal prosecutors confirmed that Jeffrey Epstein's state plea agreement was in compliance with a September 2007 federal non-prosecution agreement.
Prosecutors requested a specific wording change ('imprisoned') to the state plea agreement's sentencing paragraph.
The correspondence reveals ongoing coordination between federal and state legal proceedings regarding Epstein's case in June 2008.
